author: Nation World News Desk
title: The United Kingdom Announced That It Will Send 200 Anti-aircraft Missiles To Ukraine
text: The United Kingdom announced this Friday that it will send about 200 anti-aircraft missiles to Ukraine to strengthen its security after a wave of Russian bombings in several cities in the country. British Defense Minister Grant Shapps also called on the ‚Äúfree world‚Äù to ‚Äúcome together and step up efforts to give Ukraine what it needs to win.‚Äù Russian President Vladimir Putin ‚Äútests Ukrainian security and the determination of the West (‚Ä¶),‚Äù Shapps said in a statement. The delivery of the missiles by the United Kingdom, he said, ‚Äúsends a clear message that, in the face of Russian brutality, the United Kingdom is fully committed to supporting Ukraine.‚Äù ASRAAM type missiles are air-launched, but have been adapted to power ground-based anti-aircraft defense systems. Advertisement ‚Äì Scroll to continue The Defense Ministry stressed that they would ‚Äúreinforce Ukraine‚Äôs critical air defense capabilities.‚Äù London had already supplied missiles of this type to Ukraine in late 2022. Since the beginning of the year, the United Kingdom has sent Challenger 2 battle tanks, three batteries of AS-90 artillery guns, hundreds of armored vehicles, Storm Shadow cruise missiles and long-range attack drones to the former Soviet republic. Advertisement ‚Äì Scroll to continue The British military also trained thousands of Ukrainian soldiers, including future F16 fighter jet pilots. This Friday, Moscow bombed several Ukrainian cities with missiles and drones. At least 18 people were killed and 132 injured in the attacks in Kiev, according to local officials. MHC/GMO/SAG/EG

author: @zazoomblog
title: Cisl rinnovati gli accordi premiali e incentivanti per i lavoratori Lfi Spa
text:
Cisl rinnovati gli accordi premiali e incentivanti per i lavoratori Lfi Spa
Arezzo, 7 agosto 2025 √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú√Ç Le segreterie provinciali dei trasporti di Cisl, Cgil, Uil e Faisa-Cisal annunciano con soddisfazione il rinnovo degli accordi premiali e incentivanti destinati a tutte le lavoratrici e i lavoratori del gruppo Lfi Spa. Si tratta di un risultato importante, che si inserisce all√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢interno di un contesto consolidato di welfare aziendale e rappresenta il frutto di un lavoro condiviso, improntato alla valorizzazione del personale, alla promozione del benessere organizzativo e alla partecipazione attiva alla vita dell√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢impresa. I nuovi percorsi premiali sono stati costruiti attraverso un confronto sindacale serio, partecipato e costruttivo, con l√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢obiettivo di rafforzare la qualit√É del lavoro e sostenere lo sviluppo del trasporto pubblico locale, con particolare attenzione al territorio della provincia di Arezzo.
[üîó Leggi su Lanazione.it]
In questa notizia si parla di: cisl - accordi - premiali - incentivanti
Sanita, Cisl Fp: "Accordi chiusi, via libera per l'indennit√É di pronto soccorso. 240 euro ad ogni lavoratore" - Incontro tra Cisl Fp Liguria e i vertici√Ç della Regione su√Ç fondi indennit√É pronto soccorso, prestazioni orarie aggiuntive e produttivit√É Psal.
Fumarola abbatte Landini: "Non prendo lezioni da chi ha firmato accordi da zero virgola". Scontro aperto Cgil-Cisl - √ÉÀÜ scontro aperto tra sindacati. La√Ç segretaria generale della Cisl, Daniela Fumarola, nella√Ç giornata conclusiva del XX congresso confederale, ha usato parole nette√Ç per replicare aspramente all'intervento√Ç del leader della Cgil, Maurizio Landini, che√Ç nella stessa sede ha lanciato l'invito√Ç a evitare "caricature reciproche".
Rinnovati gli accordi premiali e incentivanti per i lavoratori Lfi Spa; Pomodoro: Cia Potenza, sottoscritto accordo lavoratori su campagna 2023.
Cisl, rinnovati gli accordi premiali e incentivanti per i lavoratori Lfi Spa - Risultato raggiunto con un lavoro congiunto delle segreterie provinciali dei trasporti di Cisl, Cgil, Uil e Faisa- Come scrive lanazione.it
Sanit√†, la Cisl Fp Liguria: √¢‚Ç¨≈ìAccordi con la Regione, via libera a ... - Sanit√†, la Cisl Fp Liguria: √¢‚Ç¨≈ìAccordi con la Regione, via libera a oltre 5 milioni di indennit√† di pronto soccorso√¢‚Ç¨ÔøΩ Bertocchi (Cisl Fp Liguria): √¢‚Ç¨≈ìSi tratta di circa 240 euro ad ogni lavoratore. author: @beatricetominic
title: Previsioni meteo a Roma e nel Lazio venerd√¨ 2 agosto 2024: ancora caldo da bollino rosso
text: Previsioni meteo a Roma e nel Lazio venerd√¨ 2 agosto 2024: ancora caldo da bollino rosso [Beatrice Tominic](https://www.fanpage.it/roma/author/beatricetominic/) Continua l'ondata di calore nella regione Lazio e nella capitale. Anche oggi, venerd√¨ 2 agosto 2024, caldo da bollino rosso in tutte le province del Lazio, Roma compresa. Stessa situazione, prevista anche per domani, sabato 3 agosto 2024. Il termometro oscilla fra una minima di 18 gradi attesa nei settori appenninici, in provincia di Rieti e una massima simile ovunque, che sfiora i 40 gradi (in aumento nelle zone pi√π centrali dei centri abitati). Che tempo fa oggi a Roma Temperature comprese fra i 21 gradi di minima e i 38 di massima nella capitale nella giornata di oggi, venerd√¨ 2 agosto 2024. Cielo sereno, con calura pi√π intensa fra le ore 11 e le 17. Proprio dalle 17, circa met√† pomeriggio, il sole presente dalla mattina viene coperto da qualche nuvola passeggera. Venti moderati. Il tempo nelle altre province Come anticipato, il bollino rosso oggi riguarda, cos√¨ come quello previsto per domani, tutte le province della regione Lazio. Compresa Rieti che, nonostante la minima di 18 gradi, registra una massima di 34 gradi centigradi nelle ore della fascia centrale della giornata. Anche in questo caso, per√≤, verso fine giornata, arriva qualche nuvola dopo un intero giorno di sole. Diciannove gradi di minima e sempre 34 di massima anche nel Viterbese, registrati soprattutto nella fase pi√π calda della giornata fra le ore 11 e le 17. Dopo quest'orario, anche nella Tuscia arriva qualche nuvola. Non √® molto diversa la situazione nelle province del sud. Il termometro oscilla fra i 22 e i 32 gradi, anche se le percepite potrebbe aumentare con picchi fino a 38 gradi, a Latina e Frosinone. Nel capoluogo pontino le ore pi√π calde sono fra le 11 e le 17. Molto sole, ma non √® esclusa qualche nuvola gi√† nel primo pomeriggio. Diverso, invece, quanto previsto per il capoluogo ciociaro, dove le nuvole arrivano solo in tarda serata.

author: Victor Correia
title: Lula volta ao RS e cobra redu√ß√£o da burocracia em situa√ß√µes de desastres
text: O presidente Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva (PT) cobrou nesta quinta-feira (6/6) a redu√ß√£o da burocracia para atender √°reas atingidas por calamidades no Brasil, como o Rio Grande do Sul. Segundo ele, n√£o adianta apenas o governo federal anunciar medidas se n√£o houver condi√ß√µes para execut√°-las. Lula visitou o Rio Grande do Sul pela quarta vez desde as enchentes. Ele visitou locais destru√≠dos pelas √°guas em Cruzeiro do Sul e em Arroio do Meio, no Vale do Taquari, al√©m de anunciar e assinar novas Medidas Provis√≥rias (MPs) para apoiar os ga√∫chos financeiramente. - Leia tamb√©m: [Lula visita bairro atingido por enchentes em Cruzeiro do Sul, RS](https://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/politica/2024/06/6872260-lula-visita-bairro-atingido-por-enchentes-em-cruzeiro-do-sul-rs.html) - Leia tamb√©m: [Em Bras√≠lia, Eduardo Leite pede reuni√£o com Lula e ajuda ao RS](https://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/politica/2024/06/6871533-em-brasilia-eduardo-leite-pede-reuniao-com-lula-e-ajuda-ao-rs.html) - Leia tamb√©m: [Prefeito de Porto Alegre entrega a Lula of√≠cio com pedidos de reconstru√ß√£o](https://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/politica/2024/06/6872360-prefeito-de-porto-alegre-entrega-a-lula-oficio-com-pedidos-de-reconstrucao.html) "√â preciso que a gente fa√ßa com que os manuais que foram elaborados para tratar de problemas em tempo normal sejam mudados para a gente tratar de coisas em tempos de anormalidade. A gente n√£o quer infringir nenhuma lei, nenhuma regulamenta√ß√£o, desrespeitar a C√¢mara, desrespeitar o Senado, n√£o quer desrespeitar ningu√©m. O que n√≥s queremos respeitar √© a necessidade de cuidar desse povo, que sofreu o que ningu√©m jamais imaginava que iria sofrer", declarou Lula durante cerim√¥nia para anunciar novas medidas de apoio. O presidente argumentou que n√£o basta apenas anunciar as medidas, mas tamb√©m garantir que existem condi√ß√µes para que elas sejam executadas. Ele citou que muitos recursos que foram alocados em seus mandatos anteriores e no governo de Dilma Rousseff nunca foram utilizados. "Muitas vezes, pode ser erro do governador. Mas muitas vezes pode ser erro da burocracia como um todo. E a nossa preocupa√ß√£o √© evitar que a burocracia trate esse problema do Rio Grande do Sul como se n√≥s estiv√©ssemos vivendo um per√≠odo de normalidade", afirmou o presidente. Casas mais seguras Sobre as propostas para a reconstru√ß√£o, Lula voltou a garantir que o governo federal n√£o deixar√° de apoiar o estado e as prefeituras. Ele avisou, por√©m, que n√£o se pode reconstruir as casas destru√≠das nos mesmos locais, vulner√°veis a enchentes. Aos prefeitos presentes, ele pediu que avaliem terrenos pr√≥ximos para a reconstru√ß√£o, e mesmo comprem outros terrenos se for necess√°rio. "Vamos fazer parceria com o governo do estado, com o governo federal, para que a gente fa√ßa casas mais seguras para as pessoas. Para que a gente tenha certeza que pode ter um outro problema clim√°tico de cair a Lua em cima de n√≥s, mas que a gente n√£o vai ser mais v√≠tima da enchente do Rio Taquari. Que a gente n√£o vai ser mais v√≠tima do n√£o funcionamento das bombas, dos diques de Porto Alegre", frisou. Lula diz que houve erros, mas n√£o quer culpados Em seu discurso, Lula tamb√©m aludiu a erros na gest√£o do risco clim√°tico no estado, citando descaso na manuten√ß√£o, por exemplo, da infraestrutura constru√≠da para evitar enchentes. Por√©m, ele minimizou o confronto, e disse que n√£o quer buscar culpados. "Essa coisa que aconteceu no Rio Grande do Sul n√£o √© normal. Uma parte tem muito a ver com a quest√£o do clima, e uma parte tem a ver, muitas vezes, com o descaso com a manuten√ß√£o das coisas que era preciso ter sido cuidadas com o tempo. Agora, a gente n√£o quer procurar culpados. A gente quer procurar solu√ß√£o para diminuir o sofrimento das pessoas", disse o presidente. Entre as medidas anunciadas hoje para o estado est√£o o pagamento de duas parcelas de um sal√°rio m√≠nimo (R$ 1.412) para mais de 400 mil trabalhadores ga√∫chos, atendendo parcialmente a um pedido do setor produtivo do Rio Grande do Sul. Tamb√©m participaram do an√∫ncio o ministro da secretaria extraordin√°ria de Reconstru√ß√£o do Rio Grande do Sul, Paulo Pimenta, e os ministros Waldez G√≥es (Desenvolvimento e Integra√ß√£o Regional), Jader Filho (Cidades), e Luiz Marinho (Trabalho e Emprego). O governador ga√∫cho, Eduardo Leite, n√£o participou. Saiba Mais Gostou da mat√©ria? Escolha como acompanhar as principais not√≠cias do Correio: D√™ a sua opini√£o! O Correio tem um espa√ßo na edi√ß√£o impressa para publicar a opini√£o dos leitores pelo e-mail [sredat.df@dabr.com.br](mailto:sredat.df@dabr.com.br)

author: Quynh Nguyen (noreply@blogger.com)
title: Wonderful Photos of Yosemite National Park in the Late 1960s
text:
Yosemite National Park is a national park in California. It is bordered on the southeast by Sierra National Forest and on the northwest by Stanislaus National Forest. The park is managed by the National Park Service and covers 759,620 acres (1,187 sq mi; 3,074 km2) in four counties ‚Äì centered in Tuolumne and Mariposa, extending north and east to Mono and south to Madera.
Designated a World Heritage Site in 1984, Yosemite is internationally recognized for its granite cliffs, waterfalls, clear streams, giant sequoia groves, lakes, mountains, meadows, glaciers, and biological diversity. Almost 95 percent of the park is designated wilderness. Yosemite is one of the largest and least fragmented habitat blocks in the Sierra Nevada.
Its geology is characterized by granite and remnants of older rock. About 10 million years ago, the Sierra Nevada was uplifted and tilted to form its unique slopes, which increased the steepness of stream and river beds, forming deep, narrow canyons. About one million years ago glaciers formed at higher elevations. They moved downslope, cutting and sculpting the U-shaped Yosemite Valley.
These wonderful photos were found by
Past of a Strangerthat show Yosemite National Park in 1969.

author: Tom Stefanchik
title: 19 Free Things To Do Indoors in Westchester and the Hudson Valley: Indoor Places to Play on Cold and Rainy Days
text: 19 Free Things To Do Indoors in Westchester and the Hudson Valley: Indoor Places to Play on Cold and Rainy Days [Tom Stefanchik](/user/160313) These free indoor places to play are a salve for those bad weather days when you don't want to be stuck inside with the kids waiting to hear the dreaded (and inevitable), ‚ÄúI‚Äôm bored.‚Äù Westchester and the Hudson Valley offer a wide variety of fun, free things to do at local museums, malls, marine sanctuaries, and more to keep kids and parents entertained and engaged. With that in mind, here are the best free indoor places to play in Westchester and the Hudson Valley. Find more free fun in our [Guide to Free, Fun Things To Do with Westchester and Hudson Valley Kids](https://mommypoppins.com/westchester-family/free-activities/free-fun-things-to-do-with-westchester-kids). OUR LATEST VIDEOS [Subscribe to our newsletters](https://mommypoppins.us2.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=bdc1aa2618e8751c4b2b6acf6&id=51ccfd15a8&submit=Sign+Up) to get stories like this delivered directly to your inbox. Best Free Indoor Places to Play in Westchester and the Hudson Valley 1. [Marine Education Center](https://mommypoppins.com/westchester-kids/stem/mamaroneck-marine-education-center-stem-long-island-sound) ‚Äì Mamaroneck Located in Harbor Island Park, the Marine Education Center is a must-do for children who love fish and other marine life. Here they can see‚Äîand, in some cases, handle‚Äîsea creatures housed in multiple aquariums. Visitors might spot sea stars, toadfish, spider crabs, eels, moon snails, and much more. The Marine Education Center is open seasonally from April-November. 2. [Trailside Nature Museum](https://parks.westchestergov.com/trailside-nature-museum) ‚Äì Cross River Situated on the Ward Pound Ridge Reservation, the Trailside Nature Museum is home to a collection of mounted animals, Native American artifacts, and kid-friendly displays that tell the history of the region. Special programming is often available. Find more local [nature centers worth visiting with kids](https://mommypoppins.com/kids/birds-bees-interactive-exploration-at-westchester-county-nature-centers); many are free. 3. [Greenburgh Public Library](https://www.greenburghlibrary.org/home) ‚Äì Elmsford The offerings at the Greenburgh Public Library are as unique as the building‚Äôs design. Kid-friendly activities include storytimes for multiple age groups, music classes, baby sign language classes, homework help, STEM activities, and more. 4. [Blue Door Art Center](https://bluedoorartcenter.org/) ‚Äì Yonkers This local nonprofit is dedicated to bringing the arts to local residents through its galleries and workshops‚Äîmany of which are free, though donations are always welcome. Find upcoming programs on [its calendar](https://bluedoorartcenter.org/calendar-bdac). 5. [Scarsdale Train Station](https://new.mta.info/mta-stations/scarsdale) ‚Äì Scarsdale If your kids are anything like mine, they just love trains. So take them train spotting on the upper level of the beautiful Scarsdale Train Station. The Tudor Revival-style building was built in 1904 and is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. 6. [Stew Leonard‚Äôs](https://www.stewleonards.com/locations/yonkers-location-and-hours/) ‚Äì Yonkers This gourmet food superstore is the Walt Disney World of supermarkets. Kids enjoy singing and dancing bananas, cows, and chickens, while you enjoy a great selection of your favorite foods and plenty of free samples. Be on the lookout for random appearances by Stew‚Äôs cast of characters (Wow the Cow, Stewie the Duck, and more). RELATED: [50 Free Things To Do with Kids in Westchester and the Hudson Valley](https://mommypoppins.com/westchester-kids/free-activities/free-places-to-play-explore-westchester-hudson-valley) Peruse the free galleries at the Rye Arts Center. Photo courtesy of the center 7. [Rye Arts Center](https://www.ryeartscenter.org/#artandmusic) ‚Äì Rye Budding artists love viewing the ever-changing exhibits in the galleries of the Rye Arts Center. The center‚Äôs mission is to inspire life-long enthusiasm and participation in the arts. 8. [Yonkers Public Library](https://www.ypl.org/) ‚Äì Yonkers There is so much more than books at the three branches of the Yonkers Public Library. Kids can enjoy storytime, musical programs, teen fitness classes, scavenger hunts, and more. Oh, and lots and lots of books. 9. [Neuberger Museum of Art](https://neuberger.org/) ‚Äì Purchase Experience exhibitions of modern, contemporary, and African art at Neuberger. The museum‚Äôs permanent collection features works by such world-renowned artists as Willem de Kooning, Edward Hopper, Georgia O‚ÄôKeeffe, and Jackson Pollock. 10. [Scarsdale Public Library](https://www.scarsdalelibrary.org/) ‚Äì Scarsdale In addition to browsing books, kids can participate in take-and-make crafts, drop-in Lego play, chess club, concerts for kids, and a teen room where kids can study, play games, or just hang out. When they work up an appetite, enjoy a snack at the on-site Apiary Cafe. 11. [Palisades Center](https://www.palisadescenter.com/) ‚Äì West Nyack Enjoy a full day of window shopping throughout this four-story enclosed mall, filled with stores for every age and interest plus restaurants, and various family-friendly activities. Bookmark its website for special free activities, like [free ice skating lessons](https://palisadescentericerink.com/) during January's National Skate Month. 12. [Rockland County Libraries](https://www.rocklandlibraries.org/) ‚Äì Multiple Locations The Library Association of Rockland County supports 17 branches spread throughout the county. This means there‚Äôs something for everyone in your family, including Mother Goose Time, paint parties for teens, Lego clubs, and a library card design contest for all ages. RELATED: [Free Museums and Museum Days in Westchester and the Hudson Valley](https://mommypoppins.com/westchester-kids/free-activities/free-museums-and-museum-days-in-westchester-and-the-hudson-valley) Visit the West Point Museum to see the largest collection of military artifacts in the United States. Photo courtesy of the museum 13. [West Point Museum](https://history.army.mil/museums/IMCOM/westPoint/index.html) ‚Äì West Point Visit the country‚Äôs oldest federal museum, whose origins date back to the American Revolution. Here you can explore a wide range of fascinating exhibits relating to the United States Military Academy, the United States Army, and weaponry, dating back to ancient times. The nearby visitors center has a lovely free gallery to visit, too, plus you can stock up on West Point gear in the fan store! 14. [Mid-Hudson Discovery Museum](https://mommypoppins.com/westchester-kids/museums/visiting-mid-hudson-childrens-museum-hudson-valley-attractions) ‚Äì Poughkeepsie The museum, which offers a wide range of interactive exhibits, is open late with FREE admission on the third Sunday of every month. This event is intended for families with children up to age 12. Find more free times to visit local museums in our [roundup of free museums and free admission days](https://mommypoppins.com/westchester-kids/free-activities/free-museums-and-museum-days-in-westchester-and-the-hudson-valley). 15. [Bronx River Books](https://www.bronxriverbooks.com/) ‚Äì Scarsdale This mom-and-pop shop opened up in Scarsdale in 2018 and is still a community mainstay. With 17,000 books catering to a wide variety of interests, it's easy to see why. Stop by to browse its children's section or attend an author reading. 16. [The National Purple Heart Hall of Honor](https://www.thepurpleheart.com/visit-us/) ‚Äì New Windsor Among the many items on display at this fascinating museum are an original UH-1H model helicopter from the 1960s, used for medical evacuations, historical military photographs, medical and surgical equipment, and more. Visit the gift shop to find a distinct selection of toys, puzzles, books, postcards, magnets, and more. 17. [Replace the Parks](https://kingston-ny.gov/replacetheparks) ‚Äì Kingston An inventive program from the city of Kingston, this indoor play space, located in the Andy Murphy Neighborhood Center, offers seasonal fun for preschoolers when it's too cold to hit a traditional playground. The indoor play space is open Tuesdays and Fridays through the end of March. Take note: On days when Kingston Schools are operating on a 2-hour delay or closed, the playground will be closed, too. 18. [Pet Smart](https://www.petsmart.com/?gclid=4285c6dd8935123acda6a349394882e6&gclsrc=3p.ds&msclkid=4285c6dd8935123acda6a349394882e6&utm_source=bing&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=US_MSN_Search_Enterprise_Brand_Retail&utm_term=petsmart&utm_content=PetSmart%20-%20Brand) ‚Äì Multiple Locations When the kids want to go to the zoo but the weather is not cooperating, bring them to this pet superstore instead. Here they can see fish, birds, reptiles, dogs, cats, and more, all for free! 19. [Bookmark Our Family Activity Calendar](https://mommypoppins.com/events/120/westchester/all/tag/all/age/all/all/all/type/deals/0/near/0/0) ‚Äì Multiple Locations Last but by no means least, check the Mommy Poppins Family Activity Calendar regularly. It lists wonderful, family-friendly activities for every day of the year, indoor places to play, and more free things to do, and it is continually updated. Places featured in this article: Marine Education Center Stew Leonards Yonkers Greenburgh Public Library Rye Arts Center Scarsdale Train Station Neuberger Museum of Art Scarsdale Public Library Palisades Center West Point Museum The National Purple Heart Hall of Honor Mid-Hudson Discovery Museum Trailside Nature Museum Bronx River Books Replace The Parks

author: Finwire
title: Bioinvent pr√§sentiert positive Studiendaten zu BI-1808 auf der EHA | MarketScreener Deutschland
text:
Das Pharmaunternehmen Bioinvent wird auf der wissenschaftlichen Konferenz der EHA aktualisierte positive Daten aus der laufenden Phase-2a-Dosisexpansionsstudie mit BI-1808 vorstellen. Dies geht aus einer Pressemitteilung hervor.
In der Studie wird BI-1808 als Monotherapie zur Behandlung von kutanem T-Zell-Lymphom (CTCL) eingesetzt.
Zum 15. Mai zeigen die Daten eine 100-prozentige Krankheitskontrollrate (Disease Control Rate, DCR) f√ºr die bisher neun evaluierbaren Patienten mit CTCL. F√ºnf der Patienten zeigten eine stabile Erkrankung, drei erreichten eine partielle Remission und einer erreichte eine vollst√§ndige Remission.
Die Vertr√§glichkeit von BI-1808 war gut, alle Nebenwirkungen wurden als leicht bis m√§√üig berichtet.
‚ÄûDiese fr√ºhen Phase-2a-Daten sind ein wichtiger Meilenstein in unserem Bestreben, transformative Therapien f√ºr schwer zu behandelnde Patienten bereitzustellen, und wir freuen uns darauf, BI-1808 in sp√§tere Studien zu √ºberf√ºhren‚Äú, kommentiert Martin Welschof, CEO von Bioinvent.
Die EHA, European Hematology Association, findet vom 12. bis 15. Juni in Mailand, Italien, statt.
Bioinvent pr√§sentiert positive Studiendaten zu BI-1808 auf der EHA
Ver√∂ffentlicht am am 12.06.2025 um 09:20

Teilen

author: Newsroom
title: Turkey fines popular TV series after religious controversy | eKathimerini.com
text: Turkey fines popular TV series after religious controversy Turkey‚Äôs radio and television watchdog RTUK on Thursday placed a two-week broadcasting ban on the popular television series ‚ÄúKizil Goncalar‚Äù (Crimson Buds), a board member said, as it was deemed to be against ‚Äúsociety‚Äôs national and spiritual values.‚Äù Ilhan Tasci, a member of the RTUK board representing the main opposition, said on social media platform X that the regulator had also imposed a 3% administrative fine on broadcaster Fox TV, owned by Walt Disney Co. unit Fox Networks Group. ‚ÄúKizil Goncalar,‚Äù which highlights the division between religious and secular segments of society, faced immediate backlash after it was first aired on December 18, even though its first two episodes topped ratings lists and had more than 10 million views on YouTube. RTUK has often penalized shows over what it has labeled as violations of Turkey‚Äôs moral values, the structure of family, or other issues it considers to be unethical, namely LGBTQ+ rights. Its critics and opposition parties have criticized it for curbing freedoms. The show‚Äôs producer, Faruk Turgut, said the series reflected the sociological reality of Turkey, portraying the clash between secular and religious segments of society. ‚ÄúI am trying to hold a mirror on the realities of Turkish society. The realities must be discussed, we cannot progress by ignoring them,‚Äù Turgut was quoted by daily Hurriyet as saying. ‚ÄúThey declared war on us, but we will fight until the end.‚Äù Ebubekir Sahin, RTUK chairman and a member of President Tayyip Erdogan‚Äôs ruling AK Party, wrote on X that outraged viewers had called for the cancellation of the show, and that its posters on billboards in Istanbul had been vandalized with black paint. Pro-government media accused the show of being Islamophobic, prompting the cancellation of filming venue permits for upcoming episodes. The Ismailaga Brotherhood, a prominent religious sect in Turkey, sharply criticized the series. ‚ÄúProductions in today‚Äôs media that target our religion and devout individuals by aiming to denigrate the names of Allah, our noble book the Quran, spiritual institutions such as sects and orders, are absolutely unacceptable,‚Äù the sect said on X. Tasci said the ‚ÄúRTUK has bowed down to cults and sects.‚Äù [Reuters]
